reviews.review: I actually played this more on xbox one and decided to get it on PC as well. I am so happy I did. It  is so much easier to control your character and I feel was designed to play on PC not console. It is an amazing game, stressful in the most fun way. I always am screaming bloody murder when I get a hatchet in my back and blow my husbands ear drums. Great fun!

Loved and supported this game from the time it came out. At fist it had a lot of glitches but overall was fun and heading in the right direction. These days the changes in the game are headed in the opposite direction. If they stop making changes that ruin the game for the people who play a lot and stop making the game for new players I will change my review. Until then I do not recommend the game.

The best asymmetrical game that is out there. If you can get over toxic players and the annoying little bits of this game, then you will enjoy this game. DBD is very fun with friends, killers and survivors are always getting tweaked to help balance the game for experienced players and newer players. Devs care about this game a lot, constant "chapter and mid-chapter" updates which bring new content like maps, killers, survivors with their own individual perks, sometimes even getting licensed killers and or survivors with an update per example: Freddie Krueger + Quentin Smith, Micheal Myers + Laurie Strode, Demogorgon + Steve and Nancy from stranger things. The game at first may seem unbalanced towards survivors, but this game has a lot of map knowledge and skill to it + perk loadouts. If you are looking for help with killer, watch Oztdarva. If you are looking for help with survivor, watch zubatLEL. If you want funny and entertaining animation videos about DBD, watch Samination.
